title: Liverpool vs Newcastle : Carabao Cup final predicted lineups , team news and injuries | Football
body_text:
Newcastle United ended their 70-year wait for a major domestic trophy with a 2-1 win over Liverpool in the Carabao Cup final at Wembley.
Liverpool were looking to defend their crown after beating Chelsea in last year’s final but were second best throughout the encounter.
Dan Burn headed Eddie Howe’s side ahead from a corner on the brink of half-time before Alexander Isak doubled the lead with a superb finish in the second half.
Federico Chiesa gave Arne Slot’s side late hope with a goal in injury time, but the Magpies held on to claim their first piece of domestic silverware since 1955 FA Cup
Relive all the action from Wembley with Metro’s matchday live blog below:
Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
That’s all from us!
An unbelievable day for Newcastle who will celebrate long into the night after ending their long major trophy drought.
But we’ll call it a night here. Stay tuned across Metro’s site for all the reaction and analysis from this game and all the action across the weekend.
Goodbye for now!
Newcastle have lift off
What a moment for Eddie Howe
The Newcastle boss the first Englishman to win a major domestic trophy in this country since Harry Redknapp won the FA Cup with Portsmouth in 2008.
Not to be for Liverpool
A huge off-day for Arne Slot’s side, no doubt, but they will now turn their full attention to the Premier League where they are firm favourites.
The trophy is lifted!
The players make their way up into the stands to collect their medals and lift the trophy and what a moment for them and the fans.
They’ll be partying well into the night, you suspect.
The scenes at full-time
Bruno Guimaraes speaking to Sky Sports
‘It’s all for these fans. They deserve everything. When I first came here I said I wanted to put my name in history.
‘We can now say we are the champions again. This is one of the best days of my life.
‘I don’t have any words. It’s the best day of my life. For them [the fans] it’s like the World Cup. People have grown up and not seen us as champions. My first year as captain of this club and it’s one of the best days. This is unbelievable.
‘This is my second home. We are making history. Some day when I leave this club I want the fans to sing my name the way they do to Shearer. He text me before the game. I’m so emotional today.’
FULL-TIME: Liverpool 1-2 Newcastle
NEWCASTLE WIN THE CARABAO CUP!
The Magpies hold on in extra-time and they finally end their major trophy drought after 70 long years.
And it was a result they thoroughly deserved. Goals from Burn and Isak either side of the break made the difference and despite Chiesa pulling one back, Howe’s side see it out to get the celebrations underway!
Liverpool 1-2 Newcastle
101 mins: A VAR check on Joelinton now after a careless foul on Elliott. No action taken and on we go.
Liverpool 1-2 Newcastle
100 mins: Into the 100 we go as Willock and Tonali do a superb job of holding onto the ball. Liverpool win it back now and they come forward for the final time.
Liverpool 1-2 Newcastle
90+9 mins: Superb from Tonali and Willock to win the ball and drive towards the corner. They win the set piece as Tonali gets a yellow card for some rather blatant time wasting.
Liverpool 1-2 Newcastle
90+7 mins: The delay with that VAR check means we’ll surely play past the 100 minute mark.
GOAL! Liverpool 1-2 Newcastle (Chiesa, 90+4 mins)
Game on? Chiesa gets a huge goal off the bench and Liverpool have a lifeline. It’s initially ruled out but it’s overturned after a VAR check.
Four minutes for Liverpool to find another and send us to extra time.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
90+3 mins: Into the third of eight minutes of added time and Howe is still furiously gesticulating on the sidelines. Five minutes away from a momentous occasion in his career and Newcastle’s history.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
90 mins: A yellow card is shown to Pope for timewasting as Newcastle make a defensive change, with Krafth replacing Murphy.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
87 mins: Cheers ring out from the Newcastle end as a hopeless long ball into the area is claimed by Pope.
Liverpool have offered close to nothing all game in an attacking sense.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
84 mins: Straight off the bench and into the action but Wilson can only fire over the bar as he swivels on an effort just inside the area.
Newcastle closing in on a historic victory.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
82 mins: Joelinton finds a pocket of space on the edge of the box but the Newcastle midfielder can only scuff his effort wide of the mark.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
80 mins: Newcastle turn to their bench now as Isak and Barnes come off for Wilson and Willock.
Liverpool 0-2 Newcastle
78 mins: Another free-kick is swung into the Newcastle area, but Burn rises with authority to head the ball clear. He’s been heroic in both boxes today for Newcastle.
